t: Luke 15
The Parable of the Lost Sheep
All*p the tax collectors and sinners were approaching to listen to him.
And the Pharisees and scribes were complaining, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
So*p he told them this parable:

“What*r man*r among*r you,*r who*r has*r a*r hundred*r sheep*r and*r loses*r one*r of*r them,*r does*r not*r leave*r the*r ninety-nine*r in*r the*r open*r field*r and*r go*r after*r the*r lost*r one*r until*r he*r finds*r it?*r
When*r he*r has*r found*r it,*r he*r joyfully*r puts*r it*r on*r his*r shoulders,*r
and*r coming*r home,*r he*r calls*r his*r friends*r and*r neighbors*r together,*r saying*r to*r them,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me,*r because*r I*r have*r found*r my*r lost*r sheep!’*r

I*r tell*r you,*r in*r the*r same*r way,*r there*r will*r be*r more*r joy*r in*r heaven*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents*r than*r over*r ninety-nine*r righteous*r people*r who*r don’t*r need*r repentance.*r
The Parable of the Lost Coin

“Or*rp what*r woman*r who*r has*r ten*r silver*r coins,*r if*r she*r loses*r one*r coin,*r does*r not*r light*r a*r lamp,*r sweep*r the*r house,*r and*r search*r carefully*r until*r she*r finds*r it?*r
When*r she*r finds*r it,*r she*r calls*r her*r friends*r and*r neighbors*r together,*r saying,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me,*r because*r I*r have*r found*r the*r silver*r coin*r I*r lost!’*r
I*r tell*r you,*r in*r the*r same*r way,*r there*r is*r joy*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r God’s*r angels*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents.”*r
The Parable of the Lost Son
He*p also said, “A*r man*r had*r two*r sons.*r
The*r younger*r of*r them*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r ‘Father,*r give*r me*r the*r share*r of*r the*r estate*r I*r have*r coming*r to*r me.’*r So*r he*r distributed*r the*r assets*r to*r them.*r

Not*r many*r days*r later,*r the*r younger*r son*r gathered*r together*r all*r he*r had*r and*r traveled*r to*r a*r distant*r country,*r where*r he*r squandered*r his*r estate*r in*r foolish*r living.*r
After*r he*r had*r spent*r everything,*r a*r severe*r famine*r struck*r that*r country,*r and*r he*r had*r nothing.*r
Then*r he*r went*r to*r work*r for*r one*r of*r the*r citizens*r of*r that*r country,*r who*r sent*r him*r into*r his*r fields*r to*r feed*r pigs.*r
He*r longed*r to*r eat*r his*r fill*r from*r the*r pods*r that*r the*r pigs*r were*r eating,*r but*r no*r one*r would*r give*r him*r anything.*r
When*r he*r came*r to*r his*r senses,*r he*r said,*r ‘How*r many*r of*r my*r father’s*r hired*r workers*r have*r more*r than*r enough*r food,*r and*r here*r I*r am*r dying*r of*r hunger!*r
I’ll*r get*r up,*r go*r to*r my*r father,*r and*r say*r to*r him,*r “Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven*r and*r in*r your*r sight.*r
I’m*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son.*r Make*r me*r like*r one*r of*r your*r hired*r workers.”’*r

So*r he*r got*r up*r and*r went*r to*r his*r father.*r But*r while*r the*r son*r was*r still*r a*r long*r way*r off,*r his*r father*r saw*r him*r and*r was*r filled*r with*r compassion.*r He*r ran,*r threw*r his*r arms*r around*r his*r neck,*r and*r kissed*r him.*r
The*r son*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven*r and*r in*r your*r sight.*r I’m*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son.’*r
“But*rp the*r father*r told*r his*r servants,*r ‘Quick!*r Bring*r out*r the*r best*r robe*r and*r put*r it*r on*r him;*r put*r a*r ring*r on*r his*r finger*r and*r sandals*r on*r his*r feet.*r
Then*r bring*r the*r fattened*r calf*r and*r slaughter*r it,*r and*r let’s*r celebrate*r with*r a*r feast,*r
because*r this*r son*r of*r mine*r was*r dead*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r he*r was*r lost*r and*r is*r found! ’*r So*r they*r began*r to*r celebrate.*r
“Now*rp his*r older*r son*r was*r in*r the*r field;*r as*r he*r came*r near*r the*r house,*r he*r heard*r music*r and*r dancing.*r
So*r he*r summoned*r one*r of*r the*r servants,*r questioning*r what*r these*r things*r meant.*r
‘Your*r brother*r is*r here,’*r he*r told*r him,*r ‘and*r your*r father*r has*r slaughtered*r the*r fattened*r calf*r because*r he*r has*r him*r back*r safe*r and*r sound.’*r
“Then*rp he*r became*r angry*r and*r didn’t*r want*r to*r go*r in.*r So*r his*r father*r came*r out*r and*r pleaded*r with*r him.*r

But*r he*r replied*r to*r his*r father,*r ‘Look,*r I*r have*r been*r slaving*r many*r years*r for*r you,*r and*r I*r have*r never*r disobeyed*r your*r orders,*r yet*r you*r never*r gave*r me*r a*r goat*r so*r that*r I*r could*r celebrate*r with*r my*r friends.*r
But*r when*r this*r son*r of*r yours*r came,*r who*r has*r devoured*r your*r assets*r with*r prostitutes,*r you*r slaughtered*r the*r fattened*r calf*r for*r him.’*r
“‘Son,’*rp he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘you*r are*r always*r with*r me,*r and*r everything*r I*r have*r is*r yours.*r
But*r we*r had*r to*r celebrate*r and*r rejoice,*r because*r this*r brother*r of*r yours*r was*r dead*r and*r is*r alive*r again;*r he*r was*r lost*r and*r is*r found.’”*r
